intro: Ozoroa crassinervia, commonly known as the broad-veined tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its large, simple leaves with prominent parallel veins. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. Ozoroa crassinervia is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can grow in both forest and savanna habitats.
